Sally hit the Gulf Coast yesterday as a category two hurricane.  Some areas saw up to 30 inches of rain transforming streets into rivers.  The storm tore roofs off buildings and knocked out power for hundreds of thousands of residents.  At least one person has died and another is missing.  Nancy Chen has more.

We have a large tree.  We heard it kapow.  It was like a gun going off.  And needless to say, we didn't sleep very well.

Richard Franzen's home survived, but the Vietnam Veterans Memorial in his backyard did not.
It's underwater.  I lost some of my friends in Vietnam, but it's gone.
Heavy, relentless rain has left roads like these impassable.  Officials here in Florida say it may be days before the floodwaters fully recede.
